Job Title: Senior Manager, Supply Chain Management, TOMY Driving

Location: Arlington, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Product Management, Project Management

Description:
Description

Amazon Transportation Services (ATS) is seeking a dynamic Senior Manager to lead the equipment planning programs team and drive excellence in middle mile transportation operations. In this role, you will spearhead cross-functional improvement initiatives across our line haul network, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery of goods. With a focus on supporting over 500 sites by the end of 2024, your strategic planning, forecasting, and program management expertise will be critical in achieving our future growth objectives. As the Senior Manager, you will have the opportunity to own a portfolio of cross-functional programs, collaborating with leaders across ATS to solve complex transportation challenges and enhance customer experience while driving cost savings.

By leveraging data, tools, and innovative mechanisms, you will create a long-term vision and implement scalable strategies to optimize operations and bridge the gap between teams. We are looking for a highly analytical and customer-focused leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has a proven track record of delivering results. Join us and be part of our mission to exceed customer expectations and shape the future of transportation.

Key job responsibilities

Responsibilities

As a Sr. Manager, Supply Chain, you will responsible for leading a team that implements robust planning strategies, overseeing equipment pilots and programs, driving performance goals, and also directly impacting our bottom line. You will also:

 Define and track metrics of asset planning, utilization and impact to the bottom-line Work independently in a high-pressure environment with all levels of leadership, and exercise sound judgment where clear guidelines may not exist Regularly interact with executive leadership and work with cross functional teams to program roadmap and execution. Communicate persuasively and with a strong bias to get things done and deliver results Define new initiatives that will make the most business impact and drive them to completion Lead cross-functional transportation initiatives, organizing, and executing complex projects across multiple organizations Partner with leaders across ATS to drive continuous improvement and lean philosophy at scale Lead a team of Program Managers and business analysts Develop, implement, and govern Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reporting for a portfolio of programs, providing visibility to the milestones and performance across all projects Establish and continually improve the consistency, predictability, and efficiency of the organization’s project delivery capability by providing leadership with best practices Completion of root cause analysis on all defects and using these data to drive continuous improvement activities Engage other Amazon business units globally to share best practices and improve end to end outcomes for Amazon customers Create and scale new delivery experiences across all transporter personas impacting all Amazon customers across the world You will establish commitments from dependencies, anticipate risks, prevent bottlenecks, ensure high quality deliveries, and increase the productivity and velocity of the team

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Arlington, VA, USA | Atlanta, GA, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Minneapolis, MN, USA | Nashville, TN, USA | Santa Monica, CA, USA | Tempe, AZ, USA

Basic Qualifications

 Bachelor's Degree Experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements 7+ years of experience delivering cross functional projects 7+ years of experience in program or project management 7+ years of experience managing teams 7+ years of experience working cross functionally with tech and non-tech teams Lean/Six Sigma Experience Background in optimization techniques 5+ years' experience using Excel to conduct statistical analysis of data sets 10+ years' experience in Supply Chain, Transportation, Logistics, or Warehousing Excellent written and verbal communication skills, building relationships

Preferred Qualifications

 Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Science, or a similar discipline Experience influencing others, and facilitating agreements among stakeholders with different interests Technical aptitude and familiarity with the design and utilization of complex systems Experience with data extraction, analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to work with large, complex data sets and familiarity with statistics or other analytical techniques Excellent Excel and Tableau skills

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $125,700/year in our lowest geographic market up to $233,800/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
